definitions.body: ] sweetness (on form v. Lag: BN 30, 60, cf. Ba:NB 13, 36);—abs. ´[[מ]] Ju Jdg 14:14 + 9 t.; f. [[מְתוּקָה]] Ec 5:11; pl. [[מְתוּקִים]] Ps 19:11; —

sweet, of honey Ju Jdg 14:14 (where ´[[מ]] = subst. a sweet thing), v:Jdg 14:18 (both Samson's riddle), Pr 24:13; so = sweetness, Ez Eze 3:3; more gen., ´[[כָּל־מַר מ]] Pr 27:7 every bitter thing is sweet to one hungry; fig. Ps 19:11 (God's commandments, sweeter than honey), cf. Pr 16:24 (sim. of pleasant words) [[לְחִכִּי]] ´[[וּפִרְיוֹ מ]] Ct So 2:3 (i.e his caresses); [[לְמָָר]] ´[[וּמ]] ´[[שָׂמִים מַר לְמ]] Is 5:20 making bitter into sweet and sweet into bitter (obscuring moral distinctions; ‖[[הָאׁמְרִים לָרַע טוֹב וְלַטּוֹב רָָע]]).
= pleasant, sleep of the toiler Ec 5:11; light Ec 11:7 (‖[[טוֹב לַעֵינַיִם לִרְאוֹת אֶת־הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ]]).
